info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 17 at 7:08PM EDT until May 17 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Burlington VT
info.description:
At 708 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Northfield, Roxbury, Northfield Village, Waitsfield, Warren, Moretown, Braintree, Berlin, Brookfield, Granville, Williamstown, Fayston, South Northfield, East Roxbury, Northfield Falls, East Warren, East Granville, West Brookfield, Allis State Park and Riverton.
Flooding has been reported on Tucker Hill Rd, Route 17 and by Madbush Falls in Irasville. Vermont 100 is closed in Warren from Airport Rd to Bundy Rd. Main St in Waitsfield has washed out, and Brook Rd in Warren, as well as Sherman Rd in East Warren.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR EAST CENTRAL ADDISON, NORTHWESTERN ORANGE AND SOUTHWESTERN WASHINGTON COUNTIES

area.areaDesc: Addison, VT; Orange, VT; Washington, VT
